column1: Energous Corp. (WATT) reported a loss of $11.2 million in its fourth quarter. The maker of wire-free charging technology posted revenue of $29,100 in the period. For the year, the company reported that its loss widened to $49.4 million, or $2.31 per share. Energous shares have increased 3 percent since the beginning of the year.
column2: UMH Properties, Inc. announced that it closed on the acquisition of two communities located in Anderson, Indiana for a total purchase price of approximately $20,500,000. This portfolio contains two all-age communities with a total of 669 developed homesites. The weighted-average occupancy rate for this portfolio is approximately 91%. Samuel A. Landy, President and Chief Executive Officer, commented, "This acquisition further strengthens our portfolio of manufactured home communities in the Indiana market"
column3: The 30-stock index reached the milestone after the release of strong jobs data. The U.S. private sector added 250,000 jobs in December, ADP and Moody's Analytics reported.Equities have risen sharply since Trump was elected in November 2016. In that time period, the Dow has shot up 36 percent, while the S&P 500 is up 27 percent. Since his inauguration on Jan. 20, Trump has tweeted about the stock market 52 times.
column4: Software robots are like a "self-driving brain engine," says CEO of robotic process automation company. AiPath CEO Daniel Dines says such artificial intelligence software is helping companies, like airlines, automate most of their processes. Dines: "We are helping them to automate a lot of front office and back office processes" He says his customers have experienced a reduction in both costs and errors since using such software.
column5: Shimon Avish will oversee the expansion of Acquis Consulting Group's offerings in the area of meetings management. Avish has led major initiatives to design and build global strategic meetings management and congress management programs for Fortune 500 companies. Acquis is a boutique management consulting firm based in New York City, specializing in strategy and implementation. Since its founding in 1998, Acquis has developed a deep domain expertise across multiple industry verticals.
column6: Neurocrine Biosciences Inc. (NBIX) reported a loss of $41.8 million in its first quarter. The results missed Wall Street expectations. The biopharmaceutical company posted revenue of $71.1 million in the period, surpassing Street forecasts. The company's shares have risen 4.5 percent since the beginning of the year, reaching $81.08 on Monday.
column7: Wi-Fi equipment maker Mojo Networks is eyeing a stock market listing in about two years. The company expects annual sales to hit $100 million by then, the company's co-founder said. Mojo counts fast-food chain KFC, handbag maker Kate Spade & Co and India's newest telecom provider Reliance Jio Infocomm as some of its top customers.
column8: The Klein Law Firm announces that a class action complaint has been filed on behalf of shareholders of Johnson & Johnson (NYSE:JNJ) who purchased shares between and . The action, which was filed in the United States District Court for the District of New Jersey, alleges that the Company violated federal securities laws. Shareholders have until to petition the court for lead plaintiff status.
column9: Adobe Systems Inc. (ADBE) on Thursday reported fiscal first-quarter net income of $583.1 million. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, came to $1.55 per share. The software maker posted revenue of $2.08 billion in the period, also topping Street forecasts. Adobe shares have climbed 25 percent since the beginning of the year.
column10: The United Auto Workers say Tesla CEO Elon Musk allegedly broke national labor laws by tweeting. The union alleges Musk threatened to take away stock options from any employees attempting to unionize. Musk later sent out a tweet saying that he believes the UAW does not "have individual stock ownership as part of the compensation at any other company" Tesla: "We fundamentally believe it's critical that all employees be owners of Tesla so that everyone is on the same team"
column11: China State Grid Corp Ltd will invest 140 billion reais ($38 billion) in Brazil over the next five years. Investment in the transmission segment alone will total more than 90 billionReais. Qu Yang, vice president of State Grid's Brazilian unit, said the company had evaluated potential for solar and wind power in Brazil. He said it could use ultra-high voltage transmission technology to connect remote areas that can generate large amounts of wind and solar.
column12: The Boeing Company will release its financial results for the first quarter of 2018 on Wednesday, April 25. Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer Dennis Muilenburg and Chief Financial Officer Greg Smith will discuss the results and company outlook during a conference call that day at 10:30 a.m. ET. The event will be webcast at
column13: Tesla says it built 2,020 Model 3 sedans in the last seven days of March. The numbers, short of Tesla's own target of 2,500 per week for the end of March, are far above the 793 Model 3s built in the final week of last year.Shares of the Palo Alto, California-based company, which have fallen around a fifth in value in the past week, jumped 4 percent in premarket trade in New York.
column14: President Donald Trump tweeted about Robert Mueller's investigation into possible collusion between the Trump campaign and Russia. He said: "Just wait 'till the Courts get to see your unrevealed Conflicts of Interest!" Trump applauded Friday when a federal judge questioned Mueller's authority in a case against former Trump campaign chairman Paulafort. Some members of Mueller's team contributed to Democrats; he is a Republican.
column15: Lear declares quarterly cash dividend of $0.70 per share on the Company's common stock. The dividend is payable on to shareholders of record at the close of business on . Lear serves every major automaker in the world, and Lear content can be found on more than 400 vehicle nameplates. Lear currently ranks #151 on the Fortune 500 and its headquarters are in Southfield, Michigan.
column16: The Board of Directors of DXC Technology has declared a regular quarterly dividend of $0.18 per share on the company's Common Stock. The dividend will be paid on to stockholders of record at the close of business on . The company's technology independence, global talent and extensive partner network combine to deliver powerful next-generation IT services and solutions.
column17: Diamond Offshore Drilling, Inc. will issue a press release and host a conference call and webcast related to its first quarter 2018 operating results on Monday, . The conference call will begin at 7:30 a.m. CDT and will include a discussion by management regarding the Company's results of operation. A replay of the call will be available at
column18: Energy stocks also rose as the price of crude oil climbed back above $70 a barrel, a day after the U.S. moved to withdraw from a nuclear accord with Iran. Gains in industrial and materials companies outweighed losses in safe-play sectors such as utilities and phone companies. The Russell 2000 index of smaller-company stocks picked up 9.66 points, or 0.6 percent, to 1,596.05.
column19: Sandstorm Gold Ltd. will release its 2018 first quarter results on Wednesday, after markets close. A conference call will be held on Thursday, starting at 8:30am PDT to further discuss the first quarter Results. To participate in the conference call, use the following dial-in numbers and conference ID, or join the webcast using the link below: local/International: (+1) 416 764 8688 north American Toll-Free:
column20: South Korean prosecutors raided the headquarters of Korean Air Lines over suspected embezzlement and breach of trust by members of its owning family. The investigation is the latest involving the flag carrier's owning family, which came under increased scrutiny in April. Chairman Cho Yang-ho stepped down from the post of co-chief executive at affiliate Jin Air amid growing public pressure for Cho family members to step back from management positions.
column21: Core Laboratories will broadcast its first quarter 2018 conference call over the Internet at 7:30 a.m. CDT. David Demshur, CEO, Larry Bruno, President, Richard Bergmark, CFO, Monty Davis, COO, Chris Hill, CAO, and Gwen Schreffler, SVP Investor Relations will discuss financial and operating results. An earnings press release will be issued after market close on April 25 th.
column22: Nike stock rose about 5 percent post-market after an impressive earnings report. Micron shares plunged 7 percent before paring losses after the market closed. HealthEquity shares fell more than 1 percent after hours, following CFO Darcy Mott's sale of 9,500 shares on Thursday afternoon. Cintas gained nearly 3 percent after the bell after the specialized business service provider reported earnings and revenue that surpassed Wall Street expectations.
column23: Aswath Damodaran is a professor of finance at the New York University Stern School of Business. He is widely regarded as the foremost expert in valuing companies and is often referred to as Wall Street's "dean of valuation" His comments on the smartphone maker came after Warren Buffett explained on CNBC why Berkshire Hathaway has a large investment in Apple stock. Apple shares were up 2 percent on Monday.
column24: Shares in Wynn Macau rose 6 percent in Hong Kong on Thursday. Trading was suspended on Wednesday following the resignation of founder Steve Wynn. Wynn Resorts said it has appointed Matt Maddox, its president since 2013, as chief executive. Maddox is seen as a firm hand and is widely viewed as a favored protege of Wynn and has been with the company since it was founded in 2002.
column25: Accuray Incorporated will report results for its second quarter ended on Tuesday, after the market close. Management will host a conference call to review the results at 1:30 p.m. PT/4:30p.m ET on the same day. The conference call dial-in numbers are 855-867-4103 (USA) or 262-912-4764 (International)
column26: Millicom will announce its fourth quarter results for the period ending 31 December 2017, on 6 February 2018. The company will host a conference call for the global financial community on 7 February 2018 at 2:00 PM (Stockholm) / 1:00PM (London) / 08:00 AM (New York) The conference call will be webcast at
column27: The Public Service Commission of South Carolina will conduct an Allowable Ex Parte Communication Briefing by South Carolina Electric & Gas Company (SCE&G) and Dominion Energy, Inc. The briefing is scheduled to begin at 3:00pm ET and will be live streamed. The link to the live stream can be found on the public service commission's website at .
column28: The conference call to review the Company's first-quarter 2018 results will take place on Thursday, April 26, at 5:00 p.m. Eastern. The conference call will also be available live on the Internet at or A replay will be available by dialing (877) 344-7529 and continuing through Thursday, May 3, at
column29: Chipmaker has provided technology to Uber's self-driving cars. Shares reversed course in afternoon trading and were down 4 percent at $234.50, wiping out nearly $6 billion in market value. Analyst: "This is precisely the type of event that is capable of slaying a nascent industry in the crib""N Nvidia has no choice but to take steps in the context of the fear, uncertainty and outrage," analyst says.
column30: Court of Arbitration for Sport upholds appeals from 28 out of 39 Russian athletes. CAS said that in the 28 cases, the sanctions imposed by the International Olympic Committee had been annulled due to insufficient evidence. CAS confirmed that anti-doping violations had been committed in 11 other cases but reduced the life bans from the Olympic Games to a ban from the 2018 Winter Games in Pyeongchang.
column31: Cramer: "I like FCX. I think it's fine. Gold and copper will do well. It's a nice hedge on the rest of the market" "Ventas is a 6.27 [percent] yield. I know people don't like the group, but that's the one I like" "Forget the calls. I like [CEO] Steve Easterbrook. I would just go buy the common [stock]."
column32: TransUnion declares a cash dividend of $0.075 per share for the first quarter 2018. The dividend will be payable on to shareholders of record at the close of business on . TransUnion is a leading global risk and information solutions provider to businesses and consumers. The company provides consumer reports, risk scores, analytical services and decisioning capabilities to businesses.
column33: CNBC, First in Business Worldwide, will broadcast live from CERAWeek by IHS Markit in Houston, TX, Monday, March 5 through Thursday, March 8. Sullivan will anchor CNBC's "Power Lunch" (M-F, 1PM-3PM ET) and DeAngelis will cover the news from the conference during CNBC's Business Day programming. All of CNBC's coverage will be available at .
column34: White House: No deal reached yet on 'DACA' No deal has been reached to protect DACA recipients, the White House said Thursday. Sen. Jeff Flake said earlier in the day that a bipartisan compromise package had been reached. "We still think we can get there, and we are very focused trying to make sure that [a deal] happens," said White House press secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders.
column35: Snap CEO Evan Spiegel recently sold more than $25 million in company stock. The shares will be used to cover Spiegel's taxes on his three-year restricted stock unit award program. Spiegel's post-IPO bonus was worth $637 million and represented 3 percent of the total shares outstanding at the time of the IPO.Snap shares were down a little more than 1 percent Monday morning after a week of volatile trading.
column36: Buffett says his style was 85 percent influenced by Benjamin Graham and 15 percent by Phil Fisher. Graham and his collaborator David Dodd taught Buffett that successful investors assessed the "intrinsic value," of a business rather than just stock prices. Fisher famously argues that the best time to sell a stock is "almost never" In Buffett's 1988 letter to Berkshire Hathaway shareholders, he wrote that his " favorite holding period is forever ."
column37: Vice co-founder Shane Smith says Nancy Dubuc is 'better than me at everything' He will become executive chairman and focus on content development and strategic deals. Dubuc currently sits on Vice's board of directors. CNBC reported Monday that Dubuc was leaving A+E and in advanced talks to join Vice. "We seemingly can't take a crap in this town without it leaking to the press," Smith says.
column38: The new quarterly cash dividend is an increase of 25% over the 2017 quarterly dividend amount. The dividend is to be paid on to all stockholders of record as of the close of business on . Terex is a global manufacturer of lifting and material processing products and services. The Company reports in three business segments: Aerial Work Platforms, Cranes, and Materials Processing.
column39: J2 Global Inc. (JCOM) on Tuesday reported fourth-quarter net income of $49.9 million. The internet and cloud services company posted revenue of $316.4 million in the period. J2 Global expects full-year earnings in the range of $5.95 to $6.25 per share. The company's shares have declined 1 percent since the beginning of the year.
column40: Gangwon province indicated it would provide a cruise ship to North Korea to ferry athletes to the games. The vessel would likely be a 20,000-ton cruise with around 390 rooms, Yonhap News Agency reported. The cruise ship will also serve as the North Korean delegation's accommodation during the games, which officially begin on Feb. 9. The governor of Gangwon province reportedly made the suggestion to North Korean officials last month in China.
column41: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday delivered an ultimatum to European signatories of the deal to fix the "terrible flaws" of the agreement with Iran. "The American administration has failed to undermine the nuclear deal ... The deal is a long-lasting victory for Iran," President Hassan Rouhani said in a speech, broadcast live on state TV. The deal was reached between Iran and major powers to curb Tehran's nuclear program.
column42: Central Garden & Pet Co. (CENT) on Wednesday reported fiscal first-quarter earnings of $26.2 million. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations. The maker of products for the pet supply and lawn and garden markets expects full-year earnings to be $1.85 per share. Central Garden shares have decreased slightly more than 6 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Wednesday, shares hit $36.42, an increase of 14 percent in
column43: T-Mobile majority-owner Deutsche Telekom and Japan's SoftBank are considering an agreement that would dictate how they exercise voting control over the combined company. The companies came close to a merger agreement in November before SoftBank's chief executive officer, Masayoshi Son, pulled out of the talks at the last minute. There is no certainty that a deal will be reached, the sources cautioned.
column44: Orbital ATK will report its first quarter 2018 financial results on Thursday, , prior to the opening of the market. The company will not conduct a conference call to discuss the quarterly results due to the pending acquisition of Orbital ATK by Northrop Grumman. Headquartered in Dulles, Virginia, Orbital ATK employs approximately 14,000 people across the U.S. and several international locations.
column45: The DTE Energy Board of Directors declared a $0.8825 per share dividend on its common stock. The dividend is payable to shareholders of record at the close of business . This continues Dte Energy's consistent dividend history, having issued a cash dividend for more than 100 years. DTE is a Detroit-based diversified energy company involved in the development and management of energy-related businesses and services.
column46: Energy Recovery Inc. (ERII) on Wednesday reported fourth-quarter earnings of $11.6 million. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring gains, were 6 cents per share. The maker of energy recovery devices posted revenue of $22.4 million in the period. Energy Recovery shares have declined 21 percent since the beginning of the year.. In the final minutes of trading on Wednesday, shares hit $6.89, a drop of 21 percent in the last 12
column47: Palo Alto Networks Inc. (PANW) on Monday reported a loss of $34.9 million in its fiscal second quarter. The security software maker posted revenue of $542.4 million in the period. For the current quarter ending in May, Palo Alto expects its per-share earnings to range from 94 cents to 96 cents. The company said it expects revenue in the range of $538 million to $548 million for the fiscal third quarter.
column48: Rep. Trey Gowdy, R-S.C., sent letters to the White House chief of staff and the FBI director. He asked for details about Rob Porter's background check and the decision to keep him on the job. Porter was accused of abusing his ex-wives, but was allowed to keep his job. The White House has continued to offer shifting explanations of the circumstances of Porter's tenure.
column49: Victory Bancorp, Inc. is the parent company of The Victory Bank, a Pennsylvania state chartered commercial bank, headquartered in Limerick, Pennsylvania. The dividend will be paid on or about to stockholders of record as of the close of business on . As of , the Victory Bank had total assets of $220.7 million, total deposits of $190.0 million, and total equity of $19.
column50: The board of directors of GATX Corporation (NYSE:GATX) today declared a quarterly dividend of $0.44 per common share, payable , to shareholders of record on . This quarterly dividend is unchanged from the prior quarter. As the leading global railcar lessor, GATx has been providing quality railcars and services to its customers for 120 years.
column51: May 2018 monthly distribution in the amount of 5.833 cents per Unit (70 cents annualized) The May distribution will be payable on to unitholders of record as at . Dream Industrial REIT owns and operates a portfolio of 219 geographically diversified light industrial properties in Canada with a growing presence in the United States. Its objective is to build upon and grow its portfolio and to provide stable and sustainable cash distributions.
column52: JBG SMITH is an S&P 400 company that owns, operates, invests in and develops assets concentrated in leading urban infill submarkets in and around Washington, DC. The company's mixed-use operating portfolio comprises approximately 20 million square feet of high-quality office, multifamily and retail assets, 98% of which are Metro-served. Our future development pipeline includes over 17.9 millionsquare feet of potential development density.
column53: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said he was looking for a deal that was "win, win, win" He did not go into details about what the "opportunity" might be. Trudeau said that he had been "very much engaged with top platforms like Facebook in the past year or two" The U.S. is targeting a tie-up of NAFTA within weeks, CNBC reported.
column54: Sierra Capital Investments, L.P. is one of the largest shareholders of Safeguard Scientifics, Inc. ("Safeguard" or the "Company") With ownership of approximately 5.1% of the Company's outstanding shares, it has delivered a letter to Robert J. Rosenthal, Chairman of the Board of Directors. The full text of Sierra's letter can be viewed at the following link:
column55: United Natural Foods, Inc. will release its financial results for the third quarter of fiscal 2018, ended , after market close on Wednesday, . Management will host a conference call on the same day at 5:00 p.m. ET to discuss results, market trends and outlook. An audio webcast of the conference call will be available, on a listen-only basis, via the "Investor Overview" link on the Investor Relations section of
column56: Maduro made the announcement in a televised address. Todd Robinson and his deputy Brian Naranjo have 48 hours to leave the country. The White House has branded the election a "sham" Venezuela and the U.S. haven't exchanged ambassadors since 2010. There was no immediate reaction from Robinson or the US Embassy in Caracas. The move follows Maduro's victory in disputed presidential elections on Sunday.
column57: U.S. Ambassador to Panama John Feeley resigns. Feeley is a career diplomat and former Marine Corps helicopter pilot. He told the State Department he no longer feels able to serve President Donald Trump. "That time has come," Feeley said, according to an excerpt of his resignation letter read to Reuters. "I signed an oath to serve faithfully the president and his administration in an apolitical fashion," he said.
column58: Intel is one of the biggest employers and exporters in Israel. The new investment will upgrade its Kiryat Gat manufacturing plant in southern Israel. In return, Intel will be granted an extension of its reduced tax rate of 5 percent until 2027.Intel said it exported $3.6 billion of goods and services from Israel in 2017, about 8 percent of the country's total hi-tech exports.
column59: Becton Dickinson: "I would pick it up hand over fist through this weakness" Hain Celestial: "It had some financial irregularities. They are now behind" Carnival Corp.: "The answer is buy, buy,buy! I'll tell you, they delivered an amazing quarter and didn't get enough credit"Watch the full lightning round here: show chapters Cramer's lightning round: Buy BectonDickinson's stock hand over Fist 20 hours ago.
column60: Mumtalakat could join other Gulf state funds such as the Public Investment Fund, Saudi Arabia's main sovereign wealth fund, and Abu Dhabi's Mubadala. The Bahrain fund, which holds the state's stakes in companies including Aluminium Bahrain (Alba) and telecoms company Batelco, has a portfolio valued at over $10 billion. In 2014 the fund issued a $600 million sukuk and raised a $500 million loan.
column61: The FDA is ordering a mandatory recall of kratom products produced by Triangle Pharmanaturals. The company refused to comply with the agency's request to issue a voluntary recall. The agency has been investigating a salmonella outbreak that had infected 87 people. The FDA has warned consumers not to use kratom because it appears to affect the brain in similar ways as opioids and could expose users to similar risks.
column62: U.S. District Judge Jack Weinstein in Brooklyn ruled that the CFTC had standing to bring a fraud lawsuit against Patrick McDonnell and his company Coin Drop Markets. The CFTC first determined that virtual currencies, also known as cryptocurrencies, are commodities in 2015. A preliminary injunction barring McDonnell and Coin Drop markets from engaging in commodity transactions was also entered. The judge declined to comment on the decision.
column63: Graphic Packaging Holding Company's Board of Directors declared a quarterly dividend of $0.075 per share. The dividend is payable on to shareholders of record at the close of business on . The Company is a leading provider of paper-based packaging solutions for a wide variety of products to food, beverage, foodservice, and other consumer product companies.
column64: U.K.-listed Gem Diamonds has unearthed what is thought to be the fifth largest gem-quality diamond ever found. The 910-carat rock was extracted from the firm's Letseng mine in Lesotho and could sell for as much as $40 million. By midday Monday, the share price of Gem Diamond had risen more than 15 percent. The largest cut diamond in the world is the Golden Jubilee Diamond, which weighs 545.67 carats.
column65: Celgene is interested in Impact Biomedicines' kinase inhibitor that has shown promise as a potential treatment for a type of blood cancer called myelofibrosis. The deal is structured in three parts, with Celgene paying $1.1 billion in cash upfront for the San Diego-based company. The company will pay an additional $ 1.4 billion, depending on the receipt of U.S. Food and Drug Administration milestone approvals.
column66: Florida Sen. Marco Rubio fires chief of staff after reports of 'improper conduct' "I had sufficient evidence to conclude that while employed by this office, my Chief of Staff had violated office policies," Rubio said in a statement. Rubio's office did not immediately respond to requests early Sunday for details about the incidents. The senator's office said it "will not be disclosing any further details" at the wishes of those victimized.
column67: Advanced Micro Devices shares fell more than 2 percent in the extended session. Exact Sciences stock plunged about 5.6 percent in extended trading. Broadcom announced the retirement of co-founder and EO Jerry Rawls. IBM announced Senior Vice President and CFO Martin Schroeter will step down as Chief Financial Officer and into a role as Senior vice President of Global Markets. The company also released fourth quarter financial guidance.
column68: Nathaniel Gleicher will join Chief Security Officer Alex Stamos' team. He previously served as the director for cybersecurity policy at the National Security Council and as senior counsel to the Computer Crime and Intellectual Property Section at the Department of Justice. The hire comes as Facebook struggles to keep a small number of users from posting hate speech and spreading fake news. Last week Facebook said it was overhauling its News Feed in an effort to promote "trusted" news sources.
column69: Sales in its cardiac and vascular unit which sells defibrillators, pace-makers, heart valves and stents jumped 10 percent to $2.8 billion. Excluding items, Medtronic earned $1.17 per share in the quarter, in-line with analysts' estimates, according to Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S. The minimally invasive therapies business, which the company acquired as part of its $42.9 billion deal to buy Covidien
column70: Biohaven Pharmaceutical said its migraine treatment met the main goals in two late-stage studies. The efficacy data failed to differentiate when compared with rival treatments in a crowded field. The drug's effectiveness was disappointing especially in the light of a threat from Allergan, Morgan Stanley analyst Matthew Harrison said. The treatment is part of a new class of medicines called CGRP receptor antagonists that experts say could do well in the market.
column71: On a per-share basis, the San Francisco-based company said it had a loss of 60 cents. Nektar shares have climbed 29 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Thursday, shares hit $77.29, more than quadrupling in the last 12 months. The biopharmaceutical company posted revenue of $38 million in the period.
column72: Spanish renewable energy business Acciona Energia is to build a new wind farm in Texas. The Palmas Altas facility will be located in Cameron County and have a capacity of 144.9 megawatts. Around $200 million will be invested in the project, which will generate roughly 524 gigawatt-hours of energy annually. The U.S. is home to "one of the largest and fastest-growing wind markets in the world"
column73: Lululemon Athletica says it had a strong holiday shopping season. The yoga and leisure apparel maker raised its profit and revenue forecasts for the fourth quarter. The holiday quarter is critical for retailers and can account for up to 40 percent of their annual revenue. The company had forecast net revenue of $870 million to $885 million when it had reported third-quarter results in December, it said.
column74: Tribune Media Company will report financial results for the three months ended , before the market opens on Thursday, . Due to the Company's previously announced transaction with Sinclair Broadcast Group, Inc., Tribune Media will not conduct a conference call. The Company's First Quarter 2018 Form 10-Q will be accessible from the Investor Relations page of the Tribune Media website at .
column75: BancorpSouth Bank will release first quarter 2018 earnings on after the close of the financial markets. It will also hold its regularly scheduled webcast Thursday, beginning at 10:00 a.m. CDT. The webcast is live coverage of management's conference call with analysts and can be found by visiting:
column76: An unknown person threw an explosive device, probably a hand grenade, at the U.S. embassy building in Podgorica, the capital of Montenegro, the government says. A police vehicle blocked the street where the embassy is located, adding that no damage was visible. The embassy warned U.s. citizens to stay away until further notice. Montenegro was the 29th country to join NATO last May.
column77: Biden spoke at an anti-sexual assault rally at the University of Miami on Tuesday. The Democrat said, "If we were in high school, I'd take him behind the gym and beat the hell out of him" Biden, 75, made similar comments in the closing days of the 2016 campaign. He has kept open the possibility of a 2020 bid for president and is gearing up to play a big role campaigning for Democrats.
column78: U.S. shared working start-up WeWork has bought a Chinese competitor. Naked Hub was established in 2015 by developer Grant Horsfield as part of luxury resort firm Naked Group. The company has 10,000 users across 24 locations, WeWork said in a blog post. WeWork CEO Adam Neumann said the deal was part of incorporating cities into the working space, as well as buildings.
column79: Jaguar Land Rover's Ralf Speth says self-driving cars would be safer in the future. But auto companies cannot be solely responsible for bringing that vision into fruition, he said. "No car company can do it on its own anymore so government, academia and the industry across sectors must really work together," he added. More electric vehicles will also be seen on the roads in thefuture, Speth said.
column80: The deal could be announced as soon as Monday morning New York time. The offer represents a premium of 63 percent to Bioverativ's Friday closing price and would be all cash. The Wall Street Journal first reported the news Sunday evening. Sanofi had been at the table of two of the largest biotech deals in recent years, but had come up empty-handed: Johnson & Johnson's purchase of Actelion.
column81: The lawsuit in federal court in Chicago contends customers bought items because of L.L. Bean's unlimited "satisfaction" guarantee. The Maine -based retailer announced Friday it's imposing a one-year limit for most returns, because it says too many people are abusing the system. A company spokeswoman said the lawsuit misrepresents the return policy. She said purchases made before Feb. 9, 2018, are not subject to the new policy as long as there's proof of purchase.
column82: U.S. President Donald Trump has not yet made a decision on whether any countries should get extended exemptions on steel and aluminum tariffs. "The president has not made any decision yet," Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin told Fox Business Network. President Trump imposed a 25 percent tariff on steel imports in March, but granted temporary exemptions to certain countries. Those exemptions will expire on Tuesday, and the White House has said it will continue to grant some countries relief.
column83: Trump will award the Medal of Honor to retired Master Chief Petty Officer Britt Slabinski for leading an attempted rescue mission in Afghanistan in 2002. For more than 14 hours, Slabinksi and his team defended their position and fought against enemies until the mountaintop was secured and the team could be extracted. The award from Trump on Thursday will make Slabinsky the 12th recipient of the medal for bravery displayed in battle in Afghanistan.
column84: Landmark Infrastructure Partners LP (LMRK) reported first-quarter earnings of $6.7 million. The El Segundo, California-based company said it had profit of 19 cents per share. The results topped Wall Street expectations. Landmark Infrastructure shares have fallen 19 percent since the beginning of the year. The stock has fallen slightly more than 6 percent in the last 12 months.
column85: Vipshop Holdings Limited (NYSE: VIPS) plans to release its fourth quarter and full year 2017 financial results on Monday, after market close. The Company will hold a conference call on Tuesday, at 8:00 am Eastern Time or 9:00 pm Beijing Time to discuss the financial results. Listeners may access the call by dialing the following numbers: United States: +1-845-675-0438International Toll Free
column86: The University of Michigan's mid-month report on consumer attitudes about the economy inched down to 97.8 in mid-April. The index reached 101.4 at the end of March. The dip in consumer sentiment is also due to the expectation of rising interest rates, thus slowing the pace of economic growth. However, confidence still remains relatively high, the report said. The survey measures 500 consumers' attitudes on future economic prospects, in areas such as personal finances, inflation, unemployment
column87: U.S. outflows from mutual funds and exchange-traded funds were second only to the $68 billion that left U.S equity funds in the third quarter of 2011. Global equity inflows were at a three quarter high. Bond ETF inflows dropped to $13.5 billion, the lowest level in five quarters. The funds received $61.8 billion, in line with recent quarters as retail investors did most of the buying.

column95: TradingAnalysis.com founder Todd Gordon says the market has hit a critical point. He says the S&P 500-tracking ETF ( SPY ) has been in a triangle consolidation for most of 2018. Gordon wants to buy the June monthly 275-strike call and pair that with the sale of the June Monthly 280- strike call for about 73 cents, or $73 per options spread. Should SPY close above $280, Gordon could make $427.

column100: Nigerian Oil Minister Emmanuel Ibe Kachikwu says OPEC should do more to stabilize crude prices. OPEC plans a "company-based workshop" with companies that operate in both areas. Exxon Mobil Corp, Chevron Corp and Royal Dutch Shell Plc have large U.S. shale operations and also operate in Nigeria. "We need to begin to look at companies that are very active in these areas," he said.
